issues.description: The solution server endpoint for GET /persons requires a request parameter 'limit' (@RequestParam(value = "limit") int limit) while neither the problem statement nor the client implementation send such a parameter. The problem statement describes GET /persons as returning all persons (with optional sorting options) and does not mention any 'limit' query parameter. The solution client-side PersonController.getAllPersons builds a request with only 'sortField' and 'sortingOrder' query parameters and does not supply 'limit'. Because the server marks 'limit' as a required request parameter (no defaultValue), calls from the client will fail with a 400 Bad Request at runtime. This is an unintended cross-artifact inconsistency introduced in the solution and will prevent students from running the client-server flow or from following the exercise as described.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the server endpoint consistent with the problem statement and the client by removing the required 'limit' request parameter or making it optional with a sensible default. For example, remove the 'limit' parameter entirely and return the full sorted list, or change the annotation to @RequestParam(value = "limit", defaultValue = "2147483647") int limit so the endpoint works without the client providing a value. Alternatively, if a limit is intended, document it in the problem statement and update the client to send a limit parameter on requests.
